channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: International agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or an agent residing internationally (i.e. outside of the United States), you can get a better understanding of how patent examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney four-day course, November 15-18, 2022. This is an interactive virtual course.

item.title: Innovator Diversity Pilots Conference
One-day trademarks boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on November 21 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT at The Little Brick Church in Oneonta, Alabama. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.

item.title: SOaR hosts training on patent eligibility under 35 U.S.C. § 101
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Stakeholder Offerings and Resources (SOaR) program presents a free virtual training on the eligibility requirements of patents for inventions, under title 35 U.S.C. § 101, on November 29, 9-10 a.m.

item.title: 2022 Veterans Innovation and Entrepreneurship Program
Women's Entrepreneurship (WE) initiative launch
SOaR hosts training on patent eligibility under 35 U.S.C. § 101
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Stakeholder Offerings and Resources (SOaR) program presents a free virtual training on the eligibility requirements of patents for inventions, under title 35 U.S.C. § 101, on November 30, 1-2 p.m. ET.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: SOaR hosts training on patent eligibility under 35 U.S.C. § 101
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Stakeholder Offerings and Resources (SOaR) program presents a free virtual training on the eligibility requirements of patents for inventions, under title 35 U.S.C. § 101, on December 1, 3-4 p.m.

item.title: Getting started with Patent Public Search: An overview
item.description: Are you puzzled by patent searching or confused by the patent searching options available on the internet? Whether you are a novice searcher or an experienced one, the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) is here to help.

item.title: Patent Public Search: Advanced tips for frequent searchers
item.description: Want to learn more about how the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) new Patent Public Search tool can improve your patent searching?

item.title: Strategies for IP protection in China: What upstate South Carolina businesses need to know
Learn the fundamentals of the patent application process
item.description: Do you have an invention you want to patent? Are you unfamiliar with the patent filing process? Are you a first-time patent application filer or new to the Patent Center? Are you unsure where to start?

item.title: Learn the fundamentals of the patent application process
item.description: Do you have an invention you want to patent? Are you unfamiliar with the patent filing process? Are you a first-time patent application filer or new to the Patent Center? Are you unsure where to start?

item.title: Learn the fundamentals of the patent application process
item.description: Do you have an invention you want to patent? Are you unfamiliar with the patent filing process? Are you a first-time patent application filer or new to the Patent Center? Are you unsure where to start?

item.title: Joint USPTO-FDA Public Listening Session on Collaboration Initiatives
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) have issued a Federal Register Notice announcing a joint public listening session and requesting written comments on areas for collaboration and engagement between the agencies.

item.title: Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
item.description: If you are a patent attorney or agent, it helps to think like a patent examiner. Get a better understanding of how examiners make decisions at the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent/attorney virtual four-day course, February 7-10, 2023.
